description.narrative: Uganda adopted the Access to Information Act, but the act is not enforced properly. One reason for the poor implementation of the act is the lack of political will of the government. The project aims to increase the TLC's institutional capacity to promote and defend human rights by monitoring and documenting human rights violations. The project aims at strengthening the existing grassroots networks and to create new mentoring, networking and through joint advocacy initiatives. The aim is also to increase aw areness of the fundamental rights by radio programs, information materials and the contact campaigns. The goal is further networking of grassroots organizations, human rights organizations and movements at the national and international levels. Twerwaneho Listerners Club (TLC) was founded by local human rights activists in a radio program in 2006. The program-makers and listeners to set up and register Twerwaneho Listeners Club in 2008.
